docs.lead_paragraph: The brand’s new show, “Margot vs Lily,” begins online Monday. And its on-set trainer shares her New Year fitness formula with T.

headline.main: A New Nike Web Series (and Tips) to Inspire Resolution Making — and Keeping

docs.snippet: The brand’s new show, “Margot vs Lily,” begins online Monday. And its on-set trainer shares her New Year fitness formula with T.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama plans to ask Congress for $12 billion over a decade to help feed millions of schoolchildren from low-income families during the summer, the White House said Wednesday.

headline.main: Obama to Seek $12B From Congress for Child Nutrition
headline.print_headline: Obama to Seek $12B From Congress for Child Nutrition

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama plans to ask Congress for $12 billion over a decade to help feed millions of schoolchildren from low-income families during the summer, the White House said Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: France's Parliament has approved a bill that will let doctors keep terminally ill patients sedated until death comes but stops short of legalizing euthanasia or assisted suicide.

headline.main: French Lawmakers Approve Terminal Sedation, Not Euthanasia
headline.print_headline: French Lawmakers Approve Terminal Sedation, Not Euthanasia

docs.snippet: France's Parliament has approved a bill that will let doctors keep terminally ill patients sedated until death comes but stops short of legalizing euthanasia or assisted suicide.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations launched an appeal on Wednesday for $393 million in humanitarian aid to Afghanistan to help millions of vulnerable people this year.

headline.main: UN Launches Appeal for $393M Humanitarian Aid to Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: UN Launches Appeal for $393M Humanitarian Aid to Afghanistan

docs.snippet: The United Nations launched an appeal on Wednesday for $393 million in humanitarian aid to Afghanistan to help millions of vulnerable people this year.

docs.lead_paragraph: UNICEF is seeking $18 million in relief funds for tens of thousands of children in North Korea it believes have been hit by the impact of a drought last year that heightened malnutrition and diarrhea caused by a lack of access to clean water.

headline.main: UNICEF Seeks Funds for N. Korea Drought Victims
headline.print_headline: UNICEF Seeks Funds for N. Korea Drought Victims

docs.snippet: UNICEF is seeking $18 million in relief funds for tens of thousands of children in North Korea it believes have been hit by the impact of a drought last year that heightened malnutrition and diarrhea caused by a lack of access to clean water.

docs.lead_paragraph: Amid a rising tide of older adults, there are fewer specialists to treat them. Most residents would rather do something else.

headline.main: As Population Ages, Where Are the Geriatricians?

docs.abstract: Number of geriatricians across United States is shrinking even as need for specialty grows, driven by longer lifespans; popularity of field, one of lowest-paying speciaities in medicine, has fallen, with some doctors arguing geriatricians are unnecessary; experts say Medicare's low reimbursement rates make sustaining a geriatric practice difficult.
docs.snippet: Amid a rising tide of older adults, there are fewer specialists to treat them. Most residents would rather do something else.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mayor, seeing that Corsico had a debt of over a million euros in unpaid lunch fees, decided that children whose parents had not paid would not be allowed to eat cafeteria-prepared meals.

headline.main: Cafeteria Crackdown Prompts Cries of Bean Counting in Italy
headline.print_headline: Cafeteria Crackdown Prompts Uproar in Italy

docs.abstract: Corsico Journal; mayor of small Italian town of Corsico refuses to provide school lunches to families behind on their school fees; community is divided over issue, which reflects deeper economic malaise in Italy, society where food is sacrosanct; critics worry policy will harm disadvantaged children who most benefit from meal.
docs.snippet: The mayor, seeing that Corsico had a debt of over a million euros in unpaid lunch fees, decided that children whose parents had not paid would not be allowed to eat cafeteria-prepared meals.

docs.lead_paragraph: The prime minister of communist Laos assured U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry on Monday that his small nation will help counter China's assertiveness in the South China Sea.

headline.main: Laos Assures US It Will Help Counter Chinese Assertiveness
headline.print_headline: Laos Assures US It Will Help Counter Chinese Assertiveness

docs.snippet: The prime minister of communist Laos assured U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry on Monday that his small nation will help counter China's assertiveness in the South China Sea.

docs.lead_paragraph: FoodCorps, a national service group, describes how student tastes can be changed in favor of healthy food.
